website_summaries.verdict: Your best best if you need a wood filler that is effective yet comes at a price that will fit most budgets.
pros: A great pick for DIYers and novices, because it's very easy to use, sand, paint, and clean up
Doesn't contain extremely harsh ingredients or have an overpowering odor
cons: Difficult to seal the lid tightly, which can cause the filler to dry out quickly
If this happens, adding water can help

customer_reviews.title: It’s a wood filler
customer_reviews.text: Dries fast and is easy to sand. I used it to fill in a corner on a dresser drawer that was competely gone. You can see in the picture that I was able to recreate the corner fairly easily with just 2 passes of this filler. The first was to get the basic shape and the second to fix any blemishes from shaping and sanding. Will see how long the container lasts now that I’ve opened it and only used a little bit, but either way I am happy with the price and quality for what I used it on.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: It’s Cheap and It Works
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for what I used it for. I used it for a guitar body I changed the pickup configuration in. As others have mentioned. Open container and scoop out the amount needed and close up immediately. This stuff WILL dry out quickly if left exposed to the air. Spreads okay, doesn’t shrink too much, and it stands well. I put the entire container in a plastic locking sandwich bag to store it .Not much else to say. It’s cheap and it works.
customer_reviews.author: SomeoneWhobuysStuffTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Okay-depends on purpose
customer_reviews.text: Very dry, non spreadable consistency. As is, it's good for nail holes. I added water to make it easier to spread across a larger area. (Dent in hollow core interior door). It sands well, but I have yet to attempt to paint. Will update if there is a problem. This will not be a good bargain if it dries out before I can use it all. Lid does not seem airtight, so time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Ambrosia

customer_reviews.title: A Better Hole Filler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after watching a video of a contractor who had issues with the DAP hole filler--which is what I was using. It wasn't filling the nail holes completely, and the moisture within it caused my mdf trim to swell. After I painted over it, it looked almost like a small knot in the wood. That wasn't good... The Elmer's is a finer consistency and filled the holes better and even stronger. Sanding was easy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Is the real thing?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used this product before but it wasn’t like any wood filler I’ve used in the past. It has the consistency of pudding. Almost liquify so it wouldn’t actually stay in the hole. Wood putty normally has a little bit of tactile tackyness to it so that it will adhere. This was like trying to literally spread pudding. It just kept coming off my product. It was a very bizarre unusable substance.
customer_reviews.author: Neko Wafer

customer_reviews.title: This is great stuff to use with carvings except.......
customer_reviews.text: If you're not very careful and leave the lid on very securely it will dry out and you wind up throwing 3/4 away just like I did on the last carton. I seldom make it to the bottom because by the time I get half way through it's hard as a brick. I've tried adding water to get it going again but then it becomes granular when you put it on which defeats the purpose. I recommend that the company make a lid or cover that is easier to keep sealed to prevent its drying out. I won't hold my breath though.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and light color!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used only a few wood fillers so far in life and my experience this is a rather better one. I have been able to spread it across a huge gap and it stuck really nice and firm. The only thing which I had to wait was for it to dry up for about an hour before it finally got firm.
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Lohiya

customer_reviews.title: Fixes aftermath of puppy teething!
customer_reviews.text: My teething lab mix decided my coffee table was the perfect height chew toy while I was at work. He took the whole corner off, at least an inch or so. It took a few layers, but this stuff was PERFECT for repairing the damage. After sanding and some paint you can’t even tell the whole corner was eaten!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for filling holes in poplar wood. It was soft and easy to use with a putty knife. I let it dry overnight and sand. The texture after sanding is extremely smooth and accepts paint well. I wish they had a package that minimized the speed at which it dries out after opening... I feel like I have to buy more every time I start a new project.
customer_reviews.author: Micabe

customer_reviews.title: I also had some plywood projects with gaps and this filled in just great. I needed several applications after letting each one .
customer_reviews.text: Really worked. I cropped some baseboard corners and had some gaps. I also had some plywood projects with gaps and this filled in just great. I needed several applications after letting each one dry first, but it was great. You can build up a gap or space with this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Mid American Dreamers

customer_reviews.title: The Best Wood-Filler Out There
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. I have used it for multiple applications such as restoring a desk that had lots of nicks and dings. This filled the holes just fine and it sanded very nicely once it was dry. I painted over it and you would never know the desk used to have those nicks and dings. High quality stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Technosapien

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very effective
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use. I bought this because my lovely dogs bite the corners of my bedroom set. I build this up in several layers into a corner like shape and sanded it down. Sounds more difficult than it is. Just takes a bit of time. Worked really well !
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Mariano de la cruz

customer_reviews.title: container more than 1/2 empty
customer_reviews.text: container was 1/2 empty, and there was dried product that was located outside the sealed part. Didn't want to go to hardware store cuz of lockdown. I'd buy it again, bot only after they made up for the lost portion.
customer_reviews.author: orchidgrower

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The filler dries within several seconds, so I keep a damp cloth nearby and keep the container mostly closed even while using. I've used it to fill cracks in floor molding and a hold in a hollow core door. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Filler came already hardened
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this two stars solely because of the packaging the filler comes in. The product itself works great, but when I received this, half of the filler was already hardened. I can't keep the lid on tight enough and now I have an almost full container of hard filler. I'm going to look for a different brand with a different container because this sucks.
customer_reviews.author: dredreb

customer_reviews.title: Good patch for wood
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to patch some deep scratches on our wood molding before we sanded and painted it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my hack job project
customer_reviews.text: This product saved my door. I don’t know what I was thinking when I decided to install a mortise lock in a bedroom door. Thanks to the wood filler my door looks great! Wetting my finger with water to smooth it over really helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill in holes in a solid wood banister from baby gates. It def did the trick I added a bit of saw dust to help w texture and tinted it w stain to help blend it. I'm not bob villa so I'm not 100% sure that's the "right" way to do it, but, I will say we didn't get charged from the apartment community when we left!
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Worker great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try this wood filler to repair a shelf with a corner missing. Worked great, easy to use. I have never used a filler to remold before. Used it like a puddy shaped the corner and let dry. Left it a couple hours, then sanded it down and painted the shelf. Could not tell what corner was added. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: had a small hole in wood. Now i do not.
customer_reviews.author: Davebee

customer_reviews.title: Great nail hole filler
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for years. It’s great for filling nail holes. Sand smooth and then prime and paint. I don’t think it would be good if you didn’t paint the wood afterwards. It would not really blend into bare wood.
customer_reviews.author: Janice R.

customer_reviews.title: bad container design
customer_reviews.text: the product is great, but if you spill it on the rim you will never get the container closed again and it will dry out. luckily its easy to rehydrate. buying one with different container design next
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good filler!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Easy to apply, sand and paint. The filler dries easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy S.

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I love the product but can't stand when companies make the packaging twice as large as it’s contents. Aka this 8oz container is only about half full of filler. It is actually 8oz of fillet but the container could probably hold 16oz. Nit picky, I know but it’s deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Green

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Easy product to work with - sets in a day, sands to a smooth finish and will accept stain (you need to stain and wipe a few times not only to get color to saturate, but to eliminate stickiness.
customer_reviews.author: DK1000

customer_reviews.title: Allways does a great job
customer_reviews.text: My only dislike, I did not get a bigger size
customer_reviews.author: RJB Phillips III

customer_reviews.title: Did it’s job
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t seem to spread or sand as well as I had hoped. Maybe mine was already dry when shipped, but it was hard to get a smooth application. All in all though, it served its purpose and painted well.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good using to smooth rough areas on 3d prints
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry and flaky
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it at all. I was surprised because the reviews seemed so good. It was dry and flaky. I would start to patch a hole and then it would be dried up before I was done. I threw out more than I used because it dried so fast. I wanted to like it, but I just couldn't. I have used other brands and didn't have this issue, hence the two star review.
customer_reviews.author: V. boadway

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Being a female in her 6th decade and never having used a wood filler, I am impressed with this product. Not only is it easy to use, but cleanup is a breeze. The bits and pieces of filler that dropped to the concrete floor did not stick to it. That is a major plus for me as all repairs I attempt include a big mess. I love this stuff and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Plug

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as needed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for filling in old dresser handle holes, make sure to read the directions and use a putty tool.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I had some holes in hardwood floor I needed to patch up. This product was easy and simple to use. Colour is light brown. After I used it, left it in the fridge and right now, three weeks later it is still good.
customer_reviews.author: Boba

customer_reviews.title: Dried out
customer_reviews.text: Got dried out. Had to trough it away after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Was less than half full but product works as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I used this on an old fireplace mantle and it worked great. I like that there is no pre mixing needed unlike other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover

customer_reviews.title: Oh i love fixing funiture
customer_reviews.text: Oh i love fixing funiture. And this is the best kept secreat of doing a phenomenal job, even for those that are not professional.
customer_reviews.author: Az consumer and seller

customer_reviews.title: Works well - get a lot if your replacing chunks of wood.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work and form. Dries in about 15 minutes, so work quickly. I had underestimated the size - 8 ounces is about a coffee cup's worth, so if you're filling in any "missing pieces" project rather than just filling small holes and scratches, consider the 1 quart container (model E842L) for only about a buck more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. It is currently drying in the shop, I will update if things go sideways when I sand and finish the project. Easy application. Will purchased more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life-Saver
customer_reviews.text: I had to repair a hole in my deck in a pinch. This worked very well and I do not notice a divergence between the wood and the patch once the stain was applied.
customer_reviews.author: lilacrose

customer_reviews.title: Classic wood filler
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved this wood filler. It's easy to use and sands easily. The little tub it's in makes it simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Re-Fowlks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to use. As advertised (don’t rave the lid off though or it will dry up quick)
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 filled container
customer_reviews.text: The container I received was half full. The $7 paid for it isn't worth the time to return it. Besides I did get $3.50 worth. I have noticed that home improvement type products ordered from Amazon tend to have QA problems.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and sand down in order to paint
customer_reviews.author: Tobyluv

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Used to fill before painting cabinet. Does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: SarahFera

customer_reviews.title: ... big missing chunk of my guitar and it worked great, it's just a little bit difficult to work ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill a big missing chunk of my guitar and it worked great, it's just a little bit difficult to work with, but if you apply too much it's easy to just sandpaper the excess off.
customer_reviews.author: GearEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues, worked fast and sanded to a nice surface. Make sure you get the amount you need, as with all wood putty's it will dry out in the container faster then you think.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: I used this glue to patch up some holes in an old wooden door so I could drill new screws into the hinge. The glue worked. It dried in a cakey yellow color, but I will simply paint over it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: worked well and stained well. first time using a wood filler so I didn't have a lot of experience but it was easy to use and get good looking results.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Janssen

customer_reviews.title: A must have in any woodshop.
customer_reviews.text: A must have in any woodshop. moist enough to handle and pretty decent on the dry time.
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stuff
customer_reviews.text: When my house was painted, the painters would only use this filler for covering the nails in tongue and groove siding used on the underside of my patio roof. The job came out perfect and after three years there are no problems. This is now my "go to" wood filler.
customer_reviews.author: Wood worker and techy guy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use of the product for filling in holes in the wall as well as a rather large indentation. Happy with it got what I needed out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: Great quality filler!
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality filler. I used it recently to repair the hole and cabinet door is back on it's hinges, as if the screw was screwed into a solid wood and not a hole filled with wood filler. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Made old cabinets look new again!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to fill in gouges and chips on my old kitchen cabinets. Sanded great smooth and painted great!
customer_reviews.author: Janine Tremble

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Probably would work for small holes etc but not for a “filler”
customer_reviews.author: gotwakes

customer_reviews.title: Wish is came in a darker color
customer_reviews.text: Great product did exactly what I needed it to after my cats scratched up my kitchen cabinets I just wish i came in a darker color. Im going to definitely have to find something to match with the color
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: This is the best. Period. Keep the lid secure and this product will stay 100% for as long as you need.
customer_reviews.text: We only use this brand if buying wood filler. We refinish a lot of furniture and this is simply the best quality you can get. I'm sure others work but we use this on high end furniture and it never disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew & Ashley W

customer_reviews.title: Gone Lame
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good product to use for filling in spaces that will be covered with an other type of material. It does not smooth out like it used to do with earlier versions.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, get's the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to fix some chips and dents on my skateboard. Obviously the filler doesn't match the board's color at all, but it does well to fill in the gaps. It's also easy to sand down provided you don't over-apply. Sanding produces a ton of very fine dust so do yourself a favor and do it outside (with eye/mouth protection, of course).
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: filled wood in flooring, long enough to sell the house, not sure how long it lasted
customer_reviews.text: filled wood in flooring, long enough to sell the house, not sure how long it lasted
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Exactly what I was looking for. Dries nicely. Sands well. I filled in the seam between two pieces of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Superheroes fan

customer_reviews.title: Crap in a tub basically
customer_reviews.text: This compound was dried out and too crumbly to work with upon opening. Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: the checkwriter

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This worked out very well. Used it to rebuild a damaged window sill. Sanded and painted nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: Good wood filler.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It works well. Dries fast. I used it to fill a couple of gouges on my hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Half Full
customer_reviews.text: The container was half full wish was not expected but item still works good
customer_reviews.author: ColeWorld

customer_reviews.title: Never set up
customer_reviews.text: I used the wood patch as directed, and it simply never set up or dried. After three days, I just wiped it off the surface and tried something else. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to spread, not easy to smooth, not easy to work with
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It fills. It sands, It paints. No ...
customer_reviews.text: It fills. It sands, It paints. No problems. But may be a lot cheaper at a local big box or wallyworld
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Superb. Highly effective and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very tough stuff. I used it to repair a door and door frame that both had bad wood rot, and for a number of other issues. It sets like concrete and never seems to wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: Wood filler product #1
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to cover up a dent in my laminate flooring. Looks professional. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SAOT66

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, dear Elmer's, for coming through when the other stuff wouldn't. I've been making a table from old pallet pieces. Of course, I'm doing this in the basement without the help of a joiner, planer, etc... so I have a lot of gaps to fill. The Elmer's putty works to fill in all the gaps, even the ones that were about 1/8''-1/4'' wide. It hasn't had to be re-puttied, nor has the putty dried up and fell out. I should have gone with my gut and bought this stuff when I started making the table, but I thought shipping might be too slow. I was wrong-- shipping was super fast and the product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jake and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Work's Great!
customer_reviews.text: Better than i was expecting. Easy to use, even the wife liked using it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis G. Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, maybe its was old, sold after a long storage time, but it developed lots of cracks while drying up, which required repeat applications with a mediocre end result.
customer_reviews.author: VladM

customer_reviews.title: thank you for plastic container
customer_reviews.text: Lock the new plastic container. It always dried out in the can
customer_reviews.author: LaDonna S.

customer_reviews.title: It'll work.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but doesn't take stain well. I'd like for it to be a little runnier, too, to spread around more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Old
customer_reviews.text: Seemed old like water was wdded. After 1 use i HAD to add water to use.it
customer_reviews.author: Danelle L

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up filling lightly countersunk screws 3 times before they were level. Allow for shrinking because it will shrink. Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Kellett Sr.

customer_reviews.title: DOES MORE THAN WHAT IT SAYS
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT A BRAND NEW DRESSER FROM IKEA. HAD A FLOOD ELMER'S AND MY HUBBY SAVED THE DAY
customer_reviews.author: SPACE CADET

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has become my new best friend around the house!
customer_reviews.author: LISA A BOYD

customer_reviews.title: Gets it done!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use either with a spatula or even with your fingers. Dries quickly. With a little sanding afterwards, no one could tell where the holes were! A must have in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lianne Tang

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Its wood filler. Seems to fill wood. So there's that
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Dries out really nicely and it's quite sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Georgi A.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my wine cabinet. Filled in the cracked space nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: $8.00 Down the Drain
customer_reviews.text: The wood filler was mailed in a box much too large so it got tossed around a lot during shipping. Upon opening the container, about a third of it was stuck to the lid a dried out. And after only having the container open for about two weeks, the entire contents dried out. Maybe if I would have stored it in a baggie or some other air tight container I would not have had this problem. But I feel the container it comes in should seal tight enough to make it air proof and that is not the case. What little bit of the putty I got to use I give 5 stars for quick drying and easy sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Did its job, five thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: This one did what it said it would. I filled in some holes in my wooden baseboards and this worked like a charm. Hard to argue with that.
customer_reviews.author: Chawpped

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I used it on my door filling the crack. It looks good at least for now.
customer_reviews.author: Abdol Hajipour

customer_reviews.title: This is good, paintable/stainable filler
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of DIY projects around the house. This is good, paintable/stainable filler. I buy the smaller containers so they don't dry out as quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill in some large cracks that I had in my project. After sanding and staining it looked very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Gage Diangelo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product was largely dried out and useless. Disposed of most of it. Ver disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Gritty for Putty
customer_reviews.text: Way too gritty to be called putty. I won't be using it.
customer_reviews.author: newigwam

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: took WAY longer to dry than it says on the container. I left things for 24 hours when it said it needed 8 hours.worked great though
customer_reviews.author: Mayim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've had more luck with this product as opposed to plastic wood.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It filled the cracks between my laminate wood floor. It was easy to use. I used a putty knife to spread it out and push it into the cracks. Cleaned up well. The only issue I had was it didn't stain well at all. The color is very light, but it work okay with the floor color, so I didn't bother with it anymore. If you have a darker floor, you may want to look at a product that is already the color you need.
customer_reviews.author: BMS

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Fills easily. Changes color when dry. Easy to sand. Arriver on time.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Worked and very easy to use, I could paint over it without a problem. I also more for another day.
customer_reviews.author: M Carolin

customer_reviews.title: def a great product. no need to spend a ton of ...
customer_reviews.text: def a great product. no need to spend a ton of money on a more expensive wood filler. elmers will work just as great
customer_reviews.author: J. Marco

customer_reviews.title: Great for the job
customer_reviews.text: did a great job at patching holes in my door frame from my dog, cheaper than in store as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: First time using a wood filler, this did the job. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: anh vo

customer_reviews.title: take that holes!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm and my door is now as good as new... Which is saying a lot because it was made in 1940's haha
customer_reviews.author: An opinionated housewife

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great... really like it.....it filled ups some holes I had in a door in my cabinet.....works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, hopefully the plastic tub will keep it from drying out, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

product_meta.title: Elmer's Products, Inc E848D12 Carpenter's Wood Filler, 1/2 Pint
product_meta.description:
E848D12 Features: -Resists shrinking and cracking. -Easy water clean up. -Solvent free. -1/2 pint. Name: -Spackling. Dimensions: Overall Height - Top to Bottom: -3 Inches. Overall Width - Side to Side: -3.25 Inches. Overall Depth - Front to Back: -3 Inches. Overall Product Weight: -0.57 Pounds. For more than 65 years, Elmer's Products, Inc. has been providing creative adhesive solutions that support success and turn ideas into reality.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
